kJssO0LW464k8Oec04VOpA.text: Me and the wife went here for dinner last night, had the Chicken, Swiss, Bacon and avocado sandwich (Chicken Club)...had with the homemade chips, good sandwich and nice portions, you will not leave hungry, my wife had the vegetable wrap with sweet potato fries..she liked that too...nice selection of beers available..some local breweries and others like New Castle Brown Ale (we had) on tap...service was great..waitress (Emily) managed to cover all the tables in the back area seating without issues..pleasant people and nice atmosphere if you want to have a few beers and have a decent meal...highly recommended.,

H4GAitP-jVp9WRk3zN3dpw.text: The service is fantastic and the food is amazing! The daily specials are unique and never disappoint. When I stop in for a drink, I'm never left to wait and always get service with a smile. I always leave happy and full

mvYhtMgO290kVG_R2KyvbA.text: Dude. We're over here. No? No eye contact?  Too busy with your iPhone?    The bartender was beat. We left without being acknowledged or served (and we literally waived our arms).  Could be good, but who'd know.   Wasn't busy either.  You're fired.

sSO8o4LCacjza4YufOklmw.text: The Lot is my spot. Had a party there on Friday night and it was great. We had about 25 people upstairs. John made us fish and a filet and both were really good. We had an open bar for three hours to go along with the food and Lisa waited on us and hustled up and down the stairs all night. All in the total cost was reasonable and we all had a blast. Definitely recommend the lot for your next party of 20 to 25 people.

_7tc8K8aupEGs9FkoX8STw.text: I first wrote a review on Lot 17 a while ago, and I thought it was time for an update.  I can say that this place has become my favorite place in Bloomfield.  There are many restaurants in Bloomfield, but for the most part they are at best inconsistent, but mostly just serve terribly crappy Italian food.  Lot 17 is a bar with well above average bar food and a pretty damn good choice of beer.   This is my go to place, when all else fails, when I cant take one more shitty meatball,  and I want food that I KNOW is going to be solid, I head to Lot 17.

fHtPSXQ5pSdE_2PgRM_1Kw.text: I stopped in due to Caliente being overly crowded due to the CBS release.  I ordered the works burger.  I asked for it to be medium and I received a very well done burger.  The Cajun fries were lukewarm in temperature.  The atmosphere and taps were above average.  This is a textbook neighborhood bar.  I would not seek this place out, but if I lived a few doors down I'd stop in.  The food was very underwhelming.  I am rounding up to 3 stars.

vnSvFuvpuIeYK9Z8Ffeyjg.text: I recently held a networking mixer for an organization at Lot 17, and I was very impressed with my entire experience. Knowing that large happy hour events can sometimes put a strain on business for restaurants and bars, I always appreciate when managers and/or employees meet our requests with a friendly attitude and a sense of understanding. Lot 17 worked with us to plan this mixer for our members, and they were extremely accommodating and eager to help us make the event a success. The upstairs space is the perfect setting for a small to medium-sized gathering, and the appetizers we ordered were delicious. I will definitely look at holding future events at Lot 17, and I would absolutely recommend it to anyone looking for a great place to eat and drink in the city.

l2uLOP5zQs969XgBIBgFmA.text: Bloomfield is the hood I work at and live in! Being that Lot 17 is right around the corner I take out from here quite a bit. The thing is I can only review one menu item. I used to live in Florida and survived on Mahi Mahi salads, sandwiches, and blackened fillets...   At lot 17 I am always ordering the blackened Mahi sandwich no bun with veggies,(usually broccoli or beans). This is a highly flavorful and tender good sized; piece of fish that had no fishy flavor. One of the mildest white fish. I have eaten it on the bun and it is very tasty too. The blackening can be a bit heavy and chard so if you don't like that burnt taste you may want to have it grilled. That spicy kick and filling but healthy selection keeps me going throughout the busiest of days!

1mTB3qTlvWFl5UR7nL0RKg.text: Loved the steak tips appetizer,$10 for more than enough to eat and very tasty, plus good beer selection!  Homemade chips missed homemade dip!

JtQSbp4kg0CDkYmm1S_tyQ.text: Hey, wanna meet me for a beer?  Sure, where do you wanna go?  You should really have an easy answer to that question when someone asks you, but lately I haven't.  I've lived in Bloomfield for two years now, and have yet to identify "my spot."  I love the neighborhood -- great restaurants, bars, local business, art spaces, etc.  I like several of the bars, but just haven't figured out which is my go-to spot.    Last night I asked a friend to meet me for a beer and she suggested Lot 17.  It is literally right around the corner from me.  (And when I say literally, I do NOT mean "figuratively," which so many people do, by accident I suppose, but they're saying exactly the opposite of what they mean! Grrr)  It's right around the corner, and since I had actually never been in, I thought it was a perfect choice.  The first thing you notice is the classy wooden decor.  Everything is all really nice hardwood.  It has a very simple style -- the traditional wood, simple chalk board beer list, a couple of nice HD TVs -- none of which stands out or tries too hard to grab your attention.  The bar and a few tables are in the front while several more tables for dining line the back area.  It was nearly empty.  We were there late -- from about 10-11pm -- on a freezing cold Tuesday night.  A young couple sat quietly at the bar, another guy in the corner chatted up the bartender, and I grabbed a seat a little further down the bar.  I ordered a Full Pint Festivus draft, which is a great brown ale from a brewery in North Versailles that I've heard wonderful things about.    After a few sips my friend came in and joined me.  She had a Guiness, I had another Festivus, we chatted about this and that.  It was quiet, low key, and comfortable.  It's a place that looks really nice yet had a friendly almost dive-y vibe.  I was only there for an hour and no one else was really there, so I shouldn't jump to conclusions.  However, I will definitely be plopping myself down at that classic bar again in the near future, and who knows, maybe Lot 17 will become my neighborhood go-to spot for grabbing a beer on a whim.  There was a new, shiny, fancy looking, electronic jukebox that I will definitely have to give a try next time!  And obviously I will have to eat there in the future, as I'm seeing several other great reviews

Q_CTVhgh43Z9TwcMMkpLag.text: My mother and I just completely stumbled upon this place for lunch, and it was amazing.  We got the peppers appetizer, which was phenomenal and full of delicious tomato sauce and cheese.  My mom delighted by her steak wrap, and I absolutely loved my salmon BLT.  However, one of the best things about the meal was the side order of Brusselsprouts.  They were fantastic.  I cannot wait to come back here again.  The atmosphere was also great!  Our waitress was friendly, and the ceiling fans were old school!! Very cool bar!

3_d096Liz77wZRUhj-YKvQ.text: My husband and I visited on a quiet Friday afternoon, and we were politely greeted by the bartender. We each ordered a beer and were promptly served. After taking a moment to glance over the menu, we decided on the pita pizza app, the special (beer battered fish/Mac and cheese) and the fish tacos.  The pita pizza: a soft pita shell with pesto, tomatoes, chicken and cheese. BORING.  This appetizer reminded me of my mother's Irish cooking: tasteless. A simple addition of caramelized onions would have solved this problem.  Entree 1: Beer battered fish and Mac and cheese. Ruling: BLAND. My husband ordered this one and described the fish as "wet" and the Mac and cheese as "play-doh". They also served the dish with lettuce, tomato and onion, as if it were a sandwich.  Entree 2: Fish tacos. Ruling: OVERCOOKED/COVER-UP ATTEMPTED. Ok, so they weren't bad, but the fish was dry. Covered with tomatoes and a bit of lettuce, the tacos were, again, on the tasteless side. The attempt at adding flavor came with the chipotle mayo and sour cream.  These only helped to moisten the fish. The corn relish was masked by jalapeno peppers and the rice came shaped as if out of a small flowerpot. The service was quite friendly, so, no fault there. The chef, however, needs a bit of training.

3MC3Pnpdt_1NlGlfGWOYPw.text: I feel like Lot 17 doesn't advertise their tasty selection of food enough! You walk thinking you're going to find typical bar food but that is not that case at all.   Everything is very fresh tasting and you can tell a lot of it is homemade! The reason they are only getting 3 stars is each time I've been there the service was so-so. Somewhat understaffed for lunchtime. :(   Also a word to the wise, their crab cake sandwich is outstanding, but deep fried! :)

dkrUZXIeCVvMAX6JoRj9UA.text: I've always had an OK time here, but in my opinion there are a bunch of other sweet places to visit in Bloomfield on a night out. The actual bar is unique and actually pretty cool on the inside. I don't know what I would call it, but it seemed to have a sports bar-esque feel to it. The bar food is pretty good and there is a good beer selection, and it seems to attract a diverse group of people.  One thing I do remember is having to trek upstairs and walk a bit to the bathroom, which was a little odd. Otherwise, a pretty nice place to stop in sometime for some grub and a beer.

EbT_2g7ejGHsj-1FSMON_A.text: I went to Lot 17 Bar and Grill after working late one evening to meet up with some friends. The look of the place is pretty decent with your standard bar seating but with the nice addition of an outdoor seating area which is great to people watch on the bussling streets of Bloomefield.  I arrived last of my party and was starving, thankfully the group had ordered sweet potato fries that came with an amazing cinamon butter for dipping!! And here's where things went south- like I mentioned before I arrived starving and we did not see our waitress for a good 10-15 minutes. When the waitress finally arrived I ordered a diet coke which came out 5-10 minutes later and tasted flat (come on people! Change the machine!) The next time the waitress appeared I quickly ordered the tuna steak salad with cilantro lime dressing which was actually pretty good- it contained won ton strips, a pretty well done piece of tuna which I asked for medium, and an assortment of what tasted to be pretty fresh vegatables.   As we wrapped up the evening and received our checks we realized that the waitress didn't give me a bill but instead took it upon herself to add my salad to someone else's tab at my table without their heads up.   Sadly to say even though my salad was pretty decent, I'm going to have to give them just an ok review due to the terrible service..Here's to Lot 17..I hope you redeem yourself.

q7TrILeCvTW0MpUOYokFSA.text: If it hadn't been for the reviews on Yelp I'd most likely never had gone into Lot 17. There is something about the facade of the building that just turned me away. I wish I could put my finger on what it is for the sake of accuracy but I just can't pin it down.  Once inside, it's a dark cool oasis on a hot summer afternoon. Wood everywhere and one of the most amazing dual ceiling fans I've ever seen right over the bar.  The food is a surprising departure from regular bar food. Between the mahimahi sandwich with the amazing pineapple mayo spread or the salad with grilled tuna steak and homemade dressing you can't go wrong.   The atmosphere is generally laid back and I don't mean that in a snarky way.   Calm, cool, collected, and CRISP.

HexnNxpjxVjujz37spSzrw.text: Nice bar. Not a dive. Nice place with very reasonable prices. I've had their prime rib, and signature salad. Lot 17 salad usually comes with blue berries, blue cheese crumbs. Food is pretty good. I've also had their wings, sweet potato fried and turkey sandwich. Not too bad for the price and atmosphere. I still come back when I'm in the area. I also still get the same salad.

f_NJgONv619v1qDn_S9NkA.text: Recently moved to Bloomfield. Really wanted to enjoy this place. Tried it 3 times and finally decided I will never be back. The service is awful and the food is worse. Don't waste your time or money here. Possibly worst place I've been to in Pittsburgh. Or ever.

5ep5KrxQmkS9Q-yYfvut2Q.text: My Merlot was decent but the calamari was not. The calamari while had hints of Italian seasoning was bland and became soggy of the cooked vegetables that they had underneath it. Plus I think I found a fry or two with the vegetables. Also Lot 17 had some funky smells throughout the time that we were there. Service could have been better. I might return for drinks but only drinks.

4kfNITdxWQiGBp9cokqUBg.text: I've been here twice and ordered to-go once.  The food is bad!  Last night our table ordered French fries, stuffed portabella mushrooms, and calamari.  The best of the dishes were the mushrooms stuffed w crab meat and topped w red peppers...the fries and calamari were terrible!  I don't want to come back here...it's over priced and the food is below ave

0Y7K4JnxiqMPl2NucQY8FQ.text: I've missed more than 9000 shots in my career. I've lost almost 300 games. 26 times I've been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed. I've failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.  -Michael Jordan

-IdxLbA8lGKCYsaUY0numw.text: The best place in Bloomfield! Love the new decor & outdoor seating! Food is to die for...delicious! Highly recommend!!

OeH71CFIdCd0CIB-s3Fy_A.text: This is more of an update to let everyone know Lot 17 has added several new menu items and I highly recommend returning (or making your first trip there) to check some of them out.  As far as apps go,  I tried the pot roast nachos this past weekend and if anyone is familiar with Atrias version (which is awesome-check those out too), this version is highly comparable. The jalepenos add a nice kick and the chips didn't become overly soggy from the meat, which was very tender. Sour cream and salsa are served on top and an order is huge-easily feeds 4 people.  They have a couple of new sandwiches as well, a roasted Italian vegetable sandwich (I did not try this so can't really speak on the quality) and a smothered pot roast sandwich described as pulled short ribs with a marsala mushroom and onion sauce topped with swiss cheese on a rustic roll. This was so juicy and flavorful and plenty to eat the next day too. There's also a new southwest turkey wrap (lettuce,tomato, corn salsa, fresh turkey, bacon and chipoltle ranch). The chipotle ranch added just the right amount of kick and I loved that the turkey they used was of the carvery style. I took half of this home and it was good reheated the next day. They also have a new short rib mac and cheese entree and a pretzel crusted salmon dish, one of which I will be getting on my next visit. Service was excellent as usual-Adrienne, whom I'd never had as a server there before, was quick to continuously serve with a smile. And it wasn't overly crowded on a Saturday night which was another plus. I'll return most likely sooner than later.

4uktOVRzaZPHdHD0sR7VeQ.text: Way better than your average "bar" food. But make no mistake, this place is a great bar. Lots of fun beers on tap, good cocktails, cool atmosphere. You can sit at any of a few high top tables, at the bar, or back in the back of the bar at a few booths.   I've tried a few different appetizers in the few years I've been coming here. Standouts to me were the fried zucchini and the fried cheese wedges. These are somehow are leaps and bounds more delicious than any other fried goodies I've ordered at a bar. I've ordered a few different veggie options of entrees, of which they have a few tasty choices. The veggie burger is amazing, the veggie pita is nice crunchy mix of grilled veggies and asiago (mmm), and my new obsession is the Lot 17 salad, which I had never tried until recently. Wowwwwww. Huge portion, fresh berries, feta, fried leeks (!!!!), and a very fresh raspberry vinaigrette.   Do yourself a favor, order anything. It's ALL good. But don't skip the fries. The regular fries are good. But I have no idea why you'd get those when you could get the cajun fries. They taste like the Andy Capp Hot Fries that you used to be able to get by the bag (I have no idea if you still can, don't really care, these are better). Spicy and crispy and a nice accent to whatever you choose. Not your thing? Then the sweet potato fries should be perfect for you. So. Freaking. Good. And the brown sugar/butter sauce they are served with is like crack. I've tried to duplicate it at home with little success. Worth the trip alone. I'm salivating right now.   The staff is always friendly and helpful, service is usually great. A few TVs line this place so it's a good place to watch a game. I'd watch anything there if it was served with a side of that sweet potato fry sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Lot 17 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lot 17 salad...highly recommended!

j-AaRtBuBNj7nXdaf3z5lg.text: This is my go to place when I am craving a turkey burger.  I cannot complain at all.  The size of the burger is great, especially when I have that craving.  It amazes me.  Of course I make sure to get all the toppings I can, they all seem to go nicely on that kaiser roll.  Side of fries is a must albeit it is hard to decide which type to choose from.  Regular old fries, sweet potato fries or Cajun fries, it's so hard to pick the right one (or maybe an excuse to come back again and again and pair it up differently).  One thing that I always definitely do here is find the Pittsburgh Earthquake crack.  Not much is out there information wise for this event, but I always make sure to find it.

eW8pJNo-GSQToqdzD2-JZQ.text: I am hoping that my experience here was an off night. I came with a couple friends for puzzle pint (super fun bar puzzle event, which I highly recommend because luckily it changes locations monthly), and we sat upstairs for that event. There was only one waitress on for the whole restaurant, upstairs and down. I felt really bad for her at first, because I've waited tables before and had that happen to me and it is no bueno. I ordered a draft cider and nachos with no sour cream, husband ordered a sandwich with sweet potato fries after reading all the great reviews. Waitress brings me a beer, I tell her I asked for a cider, she says "that is a cider." No ma'am, it's a beer, not even close. I get that mistakes happen but please don't tell me I don't know the difference. She gives me a huge sigh and says she will take it back. Eleven minutes pass and I get my cider without any kind word from waitress. Another twenty six minutes pass and husbands food comes. Regular fries, and the whole thing is stone cold, as if it had been sitting out a while. He is too hungry to complain, doesn't want to annoy obviously in the weeds waitress, so he eats it (husband will eat anything). Another seven or so minutes and I get my nachos, giant dollop of sour cream right on top. I ask to send it back, she says in an incredibly mean tone that it'll be a while to remake it, as if daring me not to send it back. I let her know I was happy to wait, that we will be here a while with the puzzles, and it's just fine. Well not two minutes later, back come the nachos, with the sour cream partly scraped off and then covered up with cold salsa. The whole dish is as cold as if it had been refrigerated, completely soggy, and honestly just inedible. No one comes for twenty minutes (I had just given up on eating at this point) so eventually I took them downstairs myself and returned them to the bartender as waitress was nowhere to be found. Once again, no apologies, just an accusatory "why are you bringing these back?" I tried to explain, but he snatched the plate out of my hand and walked away.   I get it, I've been totally in the weeds before, but that means you need to be at least a little bit nice to your customers. Both the waitress and the bartender were downright hostile. I can't even really review the food, since what was served to both my husband and I was too cold and soggy to be worth eating. With all the bar choices around this area, I'd suggest going to one that knows how to treat its customers.

IEdXebfHjjZ7erJk6eqCRA.text: Every neighborhood needs a go-to joint, and for me this is Bloomfield's. Lot 17 has consistently above-average bar food and a decent beer list. Nothing to necessarily write home about, but whenever my boyfriend and I need a meal in a pinch we head here. The service is always great- fast and friendly- and the prices are more than reasonable for what you get. Some of my favorites on the menu are the buffalo chicken sandwich, blackened mahi sandwich (ask for extra seasoning!), and the reuben. The homemade chips and cajun fries for sides are great compliments to anything on their menu. For an extra incentive to try it out, you can purchase a $50 "hot card" for just $25 through PG Daily Deals (deals.post-gazette.com) and use it here or at any one of about 30 participating restaurants... just look for whatever restaurant they are featuring with the hot card to get one!

yl0OIBBKBBnSzVPQFwU8ww.text: Lot 17 was clean, friendly, and had great service.  Hard to ask for anything more.  The minute I walked in I was greeted and the bartender/owner was very nice and recommended a great beer even giving me a sample first.  Everyone in the whole place, patrons and staff alike were pleasant and polite and nice to talk to.  It was a very enjoyable experience. I've had their pretzels and they are DELICIOUS.  I'm very excited to try their other food.  I will definitely be going back.  UPDATE: I have had more of their food and it all holds up.  When I'm in the mood for french fries this is where I go.  Their potroast sandwich has become my ultimate go to comfort food and their salmon BLT is just, so good.  Their food combined with $3.50 22 oz yuenglings all day every day makes this a great spot.

r-pQdRvmgu0fv2i9Wx20qQ.text: I've been to Lot 17 twice now for animal rescue related events, what a great place! Plenty of space around the bar/table areas to stretch out and kick back with your pals. Great beer selection, delicious food and huge TVs to watch the game on. I hope to swing by Lot 17 again in the near future! (and THANKS for supporting the animal rescue community!!)

yXv7GNNQgFwZ-lbk5BRQ_Q.text: Bar food and a low key atmosphere. It's a nice local dive bar. Fried food almost always tastes good with a cocktail or a cold beer.  The upstairs has a separate bar/room that can be reserved for private parties. I would go back again.

mv8QkKEZ-R0H3y-8uknQgw.text: I have to give Lot 17 4 stars because they are really that good!    Take out experience here is A+++++++ Fast, packed to maintain the integrity of the food (and not get messy or mushy depending on what you had ordered), and yummy!  I have tried several different things here, and they all were satisfying, but the most satisfying aspect of Lot 17 was the fact that when a coworker had an issue, they made it right and went above and beyond... many places sadly do not do that anymore.  Because of this experience and my other great ones, I will continue to come back and recommend Lot 17!

6TNmOBVFz8Hb1NtkXA2agA.text: Atmosphere Nice / Sports on every television with Volume Up Boooooo! Bread Pudding by far the Bestest in the Burgh!

QGzTqM1uB_t3qBaxB3lIWA.text: I always enjoy my time at Lot 17. You can just hang out and grab a beer or enjoy some food in the back. The food is amazing. I especially enjoy the Mediterranean Seafood Salad. It is a MUST ORDER. The sweet potato fries are a great compliment to any of the burgers, wraps, or sandwiches. Go to Lot 17, you will not regret it.

Jn71egdb27Z46N0be4Ehfg.text: Stopped by Lot 17 for some apps and drinks with a few girlfriends.  I was in the mood for some fries and got the regular ones which were piping hot and fresh when they came out.  I ordered a glass of cabernet but I probably should have opted for beer.   Decent place for drinks and apps - it was crowded so they must be doing something right.  I would check this place out again and try a full meal.

3eV0xK2W4loR3rm_meTqaA.text: Another great meal stop on tour!  Tons of microbrews on tap, and tasty food too!  Friendly staff, comfortable seating, very clean!  Hopefully I get back to the Pittsburgh area again for another visit.

OdKYbCVoyUM2jAtVSnCEpQ.text: Today my boyfriend and myself went to Lot for brunch. It was delicious and very reasonably priced. I had the 2 eggs, potatoes, toast and bacon and it was delicious. My boyfriend had the breakfast sandwich (I can't remember the exact name) but he stated it was one of the best breakfast sandwiches he has ever had. The Bloody Marys were also on point! I think we have found our new Sunday morning brunch spot.

Aj_iryFs2elJbwgiZVRF-Q.text: If I'm rating Lot 17 solely on their food, you'd only one or two stars next to my review, but since they have NFL Sunday Ticket and it's a chill place to go on a Sunday to catch a game so I'm willing to give three stars.  The food is just not good...at least everything that I've tried. Even for bar food, Lot 17 struggles to put out a decent product. The zucchini strips were way too greasy. Yes, I've never met a non-greasy fried zucchini strip, but these are saturated and almost taste like they came out of a bag pre-breaded. Definitely lacking that hand-breaded aspect. The chicken nachos were made with seemingly-stale tortilla chips and were so bland that I actually left more than half of the plate uneaten. That's a rarity for me, a self-proclaimed nacho addict. I've also tried the cheese wedges and the chicken tenders. The cheese wedges are another product that seems so simple to pull off, yet they come out cold and greasy. The only app that we enjoy at al is the chicken tenders, but while they're decent, the rest of the food that we've tried was so blah that I haven't been able to bring myself to ordering an actual meal or sandwich from the menu. Hence, why you see only a review of apps.  Fortunately, just when all hope seems lost, they flip on my game and their solid beer list swoops in to save the day.  Service can be spotty, but it's been decent at the bar every time that we've gone. At some point I'll have to try a sandwich or meal, but it's really hard to fake an appetite after knowing what kind of product they're willing to serve for appetizers. Hopefully I'll be able to improve my review after trying more of the menu. Fingers crossed.

fCs4feYfF-XkpGnD2znKXQ.text: This place is the real stuff. Just moved from portland OR. and its the only place that reminds me of home. Great food, great drinks, and great peeps. If you really wont to experience Bloomfield to its fullest, two words.......Sunday Funday. Check it out and you wont be disappointed. #gopitt

_2RmvJ2z0hRuJgfWTTB7Jg.text: I've been going here a lot lately, great beer selection, friendly staff. I keep saying I'm going to try something new, but I haven't, blackened chicken wrap is great, sweet potato fries are amazing, the bartender even went out of his way to use his horseradish for his bloody marys and make me some horsey mayo to dip my fries in.

ixgWsZpJLEFuJ2NlwYJLRQ.text: First dozen wings were good.  Second dozen disappointing.  Under cooked to the point where they were inedible.  Overall, disappointed.  I expected more for the hype.  If you are okay with mediocre bar food and a decent bar atmosphere with not enough help, this is your spot.

vN01ZZ18AadmRnhV2SN9gQ.text: Lot 17 is the perfect neighborhood spot for any way you might be feeling. Trust me, I've felt all types of ways going to Lot 17. Be it a few drinks before getting rowdy, watching a game, a few drinks after getting rowdy, a nice place to relax, dinner with friends, dinner with family, dinner alone, jonesing for ribs, drinking alone, just-got-fired-need-a-bourbon, just-got-hired-need-a-Yuengling, just-got-promoted-shots-all-around...whatever atmosphere you're looking for, chances are Lot 17 can help you out.  The staff is friendly and casual (sometimes negligent but they're generally nice about everything), the cooks provide a nice twist on casual barfood (they have healthy options and daily specials), the drinks are cheap, the rotating draft list is spot-on, the pours are generous, and they have booths in the back. What more could you ask for?  Try the ribs. No, the mac and cheese. No, try the Mediterranean salad. No, wait, try the coconut crusted chicken fingers.

mg9H5uyQdjvwEXVfTVoabw.text: Tried out the brunch at this place. There was no wait and the staff was very nice. There is also a $14 mimosa pitcher special. I had the Sunday morning melt. It tasted good but I'm not a fan of hard/French bread so I wouldn't order it again. It's seems like a good brunch spot if you're looking for a last minute brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Lot 17 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sunday Morning Melt
Photo of Lot 17 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brunch menu

Zy0CgqqUSp_QpetRE7ikuQ.text: I don't understand the new Brunch trend. To me it just seems like breakfast and an excuse to drink in the morning. Having said that, the BF and I have finally joined in on the brunch band wagon. Of course, I'm not a drinker, so it was really breakfast, but whatever. The BF had the eggs and bacon, which comes with potatoes and toast. It was a solid breakfast. I thought the eggs were cooked to perfection; not over done or rubbery at all. I think the bacon comes from DJ's butcher shop (which would make sense considering it's two stores down) but either way it was top notch stuff. Thick cut with very little fat.  I got the morning melt, which is an egg sandwich on grilled bread, kind of like a grilled cheese. It had eggs, bacon and lots of cheese. I wasn't really expecting it to be grilled but it was a fortuitous mistake, cause dam it was yummy. It comes on the same French bread as the toast and is a pretty big sandwich. I only ate half and let the BF have some and there was still some to take home! It also came with potatoes as well, so.... The other brunch options were a sunrise burger, that comes with an egg on top, salted caramel French toast and a couple other things. It was a small menu, like most Brunch menus, but it had some decent sounding options. I also saw lots of carafes of Mimosas and other fruity-looking morning cocktails, so they've got that covered as well. Overall I may not really understand the brunch phase, but I love all the new places serving breakfast options.

BiwoeWcbHbflkFSplx5LGw.text: It is a shame that this place has such horrible service because their food is absolutely amazing. It is one of my favorite spots in Bloomfield but every time I come the service is terrible. We went an entire meal without getting one refill of water, our waitress didn't check in on us once, and didn't bother to ask us if we needed anything else before putting the check down and leaving. This place deserves 5 stars but the service is consistently horrible.

98sp4EbgZx_SlX4GW3nzdw.text: I live in the neighborhood and want to be able to say awesome things about every business here. Just can't do it. Yeah prices are good and food is ok and comes out quick but there's nothing special going on here. Sports Bar in every sense of the phrase from televised sports to the sports fan patrons. Not my scene.

v4naBkAOC6MtPts26-oFNw.text: With a Just Pay Half Hot Card in my hands and an imminent wall-shaker of a concert at nearby Howler's recently, I strolled into Lot 17's darkened but genial beer hall-ish environs for eats and came away satisfied. Deciding not to go with a burger for the umpteenth time, I instead chose the Jamaican Jerk Chicken Sandwich, which comes complete with a pineapple ring, a drape of provolone cheese, and roasted red peppers. It's shame that the exquisitely tender chicken didn't smack much of jerk seasoning, though. Nonetheless, sweet, savory, tart, and creamy cavorted brilliantly together within a Sunday dinner-worthy Kaiser roll on a Saturday night. A flawless pile of housemade, kettle-plunged, perfectly salted potato chips complimented the soft and juicy sandwich with their inherent crunch factor. A domineering cleat of an after-dinner treat, the Snickers Ice Cream Pie had me bug-eyed upon its arrival, something my wonderful server (name forgotten) got a laugh out of. Carvel had nothing on this monstrosity of vanilla and chocolate ice cream that was garnished with nuts, candy pieces, and sauces of the caramel, white chocolate, and dark chocolate varieties. An Oreo crust would hold this sundae-on-a-plate together, bringing more texture as well as stability to this luscious, saccharine, bon-bon-riddled masterpiece of frozen confection. With quick, courteous, adept service and above average bar food, Lot 17 has hollowed out a deserved niche for itself in this restaurant-heavy area of Pittsburgh. Considering I have credit left on that card and that Hot Card participants are dwindling, I may be overdue for another visit, and it will be without a hint of reluctance, Lot 17 proving itself to be a sturdy dining option in a neighborhood with much... youtube.com/watch?v=5U9w...

Photo of Lot 17 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Snickers pie
Photo of Lot 17 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Jamaican jerk chicken sandwich with homemade potato chips

jHuqFT9jZcnzW_VXR4oRUA.text: Love this bar, my favorite bloomfield location and a definitely preference for the Sunday daytime crew.  Homey feeling and a good selection of bar foods on the menu. I was pleased with my chicken. The favorite highlight was the Talking Heads Pandora channel playing so good old Cure, David Bowie, Talking Heads etc music.  Love it and can't wait to go back.

D--98NPZBCTsFvQCFkBQAA.text: From the provolone wedges & marinara to the fish sandwich & burger EVERYTHING was delicious. The service was fantastic.  We'll be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Lot 17 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. From the provolone wedges &amp; marinara to the fish sandwich &amp; burger EVERYTHING was excellent. Very very impressive service too!

SQNQD_lfw_eSh7XRIccAZQ.text: Great food and service! Everything is super fresh! We love going their for lunch on the weekends! I love the wraps! Their chicken is super moist... I would also highly recommend the sweet potato fries with special dipping sauce! Super crunchy and flavorful!

zpA414VPBWOGyDwB8k0Lig.text: So so draft selection, service and food. The location is awesome, the decor is beautiful, but I wasn't impressed either time I came here. They don't have a happy hour menu, just a small discount on beers. The first time I stopped by was for drinks only and the second time, I decided to grab something to eat. I ordered the chicken fingers with the house special coconut. I assumed that the house special coconut was a dipping sauce, but it was actually how the chicken fingers were breaded. They were very good with bbq sauce. Several people at our table (party of 8) ordered the chicken fingers- all in different ways. I understand how as a server it may be confusing when that occurs, but coming from someone who served in a restaurant for many years, I think it's your job to know where the food goes. Write it down with their names and there would be a problem. Our server didn't do that, meaning food was going to the wrong people and it caused a lot of unnecessary confusion and disturbed our experience. I then ordered the sriracha chicken wrap and sweet potato fries to go and grabbed my boyfriend the jalapeno steak wrap. We both thought they were good, but definitely not something to write home about or even return for. Nothing was bad, but it wasn't amazing either. That just about sums up my entire experience here.

tDrucAbPeR2C0_f6854Wiw.text: My favorite bar in Pittsburgh. They should change the motto to "Good Times. Good Laughs. Good Friends".

2hFXJQJ3UrMZVJNo4tbFuA.text: Stopped in around 2:30  in the afternoon and sat outside, did not go in. Had a great blackened Mahi sandwich and would definitely recommend.  I will be back next time I am in the area.  Server also was polite and attentive.

JwAVUtfvJETEMnLNwbre_g.text: Went here on a random Tuesday afternoon. We were one of a few people in the restaurant, and the only ones at the bar, initially.  Add far as aesthetics, I've always loved the old fashioned fan above the bar, and the bar itself. It truly is a "Pittsburgh" bar. They have made some really smart enhancements, though. One, the open window bar overlooking the street. Love it! They also have a retractable awning for the patio seating which is thoughtful and unique to the area.   We just had a drink, but I took a look at their new menu and it all sounds really tasty, and prices seem very fair. Nice style to the menu, also. As new bars come into the area, it's inevitable that a business might feel the need to change to keep up with their neighbors. Lot 17 had done just enough without ruining their already great vibe! As always, very nice service!

LHFi3gvjQFKwHq2eycL6jQ.text: My parents and I we planning on going to another restaurant tonight and after finding out it is closed on Sundays, we decided to try Lot 17. I've driven past this place several times and always said I wanted to try it. I'm so glad we did.   The physical menu was slightly different from the one online, but only because they had JUST updated it. One of the items featured under the salad section was a Chicken Salad with cucumbers, tomatoes, cheddar cheese and french fries. I asked if they would make it a buffalo chicken salad and they were incredibly accommodating, even asking if I'd prefer the buffalo chicken to be fried or grilled. The salad was delicious!!!!   Mom ordered a burger that was not on the online menu. It was the buffalo burger. Not buffalo meat. Buffalo sauce! That's right, they flavor the burger patty with ranch powder and pour buffalo sauce on top and melt a nice slice of mozzarella cheese on top! PLUS the burger patty was bigger than the bun itself. She thoroughly enjoyed it.   Dad ordered a Ruben sandwich with sweet potato fries. He said it was really tasty! Not to mention the fact that this place serves a special homemade sweet butter with their sweet potato fries.   There were very few customers inside, which surprised me, since it was around 6:00pm. But because of that the service was exceptional. The chef even came out and was thrilled to see that we just about licked our plates clean!  We will definitely be coming back here!

doadCcfKctTPwMLYUAc5EQ.text: Heard about this place from my sister/brother in law. Was very good! It's in an old building with a tin cieling and exposed brick walls keep the great feel of history. We had the stuffed banana peppers, buffalo chicken mac/cheese and the Bavarian grilled pork loin sandwich. The garlic bread served with the peppers was awesome! The server was great too!! Our daughters share the same name and that opened lots of conversation. She was very welcoming and accommodating. We'll definitely be back!

7_HXIJCGTBNud3MjI29IiA.text: Service was mediocre and our waitress was a little too casual and did not talk much. But the food we ordered (wings and tacos) were great! It was Taco Tuesday so the tacos was only $2 each! It was also pretty easy to find free street parking after 6PM on a week day.

Z-qDdlxIhQfb73whSK7abA.text: First experience here was so so. It's cheap. It's fast. But maybe a little too fast. Not following me?  Well... The service was super fast, but the server seemed less interested in helping us choose what app or wine to get and more into just getting our orders and darting off. I can't say that she wasn't attentive because I barely finished my wine before she asked me if I wanted another. I'll take that over bad service any day though!  We ordered a couple apps with our drinks and there were more misses than hits. The fries were skinny and bland. The calamari was probably the worst I've ever had, but the crab stuffed portobello's... Awesome! Weird right?   So honestly I wouldn't be opposed to stopping in again, I'd just be very very careful with what I order. Maybe thoroughly research the other reviews for the good stuff. I mean, hey... Isn't that what Yelp's for!?

4KRpBr9q_MlyhSHH9WxBAg.text: Lot 17 is my go-to place in Bloomfield for a good, reasonably-priced meal, a good and monthly-changing selection of draft beers, good service and overall good vibes. It's not uncommon for my wife and I to go here 3-4x a month and on multiple times we've brought friends and family along because we've consistently had good experiences here.  The staff is friendly and attentive and the food is consistently good. For a 9 dollars, I often get the buffalo chicken wrap and fries. My wife sometimes gets one of the other chicken wraps (which are also good) or gets a salad. They always have a special and the times that I was inclined to try it, I didn't leave disappointed either. Usually, on average, for two wraps and appetizer and a drink each, our bill is no more than 35 dollars. I think the best thing about Lot 17 is that it's family owned... the owners are always around and take an interest in ensuring their customers have a good experience.

zAusYqeYCAC8ugcbLs6q4Q.text: Fantastic.  Absolutely Fantastic. We had Guinness and Beef stew then short ribs mac n'Cheese. The best one so far.   Bloody Mary is made "with love" with a lot of ingredients and spicy just enough!  Service is great too. Cool, relax atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of Lot 17 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Short ribs Mac n&#39; cheese

_6ZI0yFPdRkXp2sMqLaNWw.text: I visited Lot 17 on an uncommonly warm late Friday in October for lunch with a buddy from work. We were walking down Liberty and went into Lot 17 on a lark. I wish that lark would have kept me going down Liberty Ave. to find somewhere else with tastier grub.  When we walked into the restaurant, it was totally dead aside from one other table of diners. I figured the place should be bustling since it was such a delightful day outside, but I soon came to realize why the place was a ghost town.  The simple lunch menu of burgers, sandwiches, salads, and wraps is nice and compact. I chose a turkey burger and regular fries, which arrived in a timely fashion. The fries were tasty... after I salted them. There was absolutely no salt of them when they came out. The turkey burger was seasoned well, but it was dry as a bone. I suspect the turkey patty was frozen, but the burger was so overcooked, I cannot say for sure.  Our server was attentive and friendly. The building is clean, polished, and has some nice HDTVs.   When I chose  to go to Lot 17, I figured I was trying it out for the first time. After we ate lunch, I realized I had gone there once in the past for lunch with other co-workers. What does this mean? Lot 17 is ultimately a forgettable lunch destination. Even with my below-average experience, I think the place has potential, but the execution was just not there on my visit. I hope they can step it up at lunch in the future.

SsasY27N_X14qJ-D7DfzUQ.text: Get the Nachos!!!  Great place to eat and socialize. Their menu is pretty basic but they make great tasting food! They could add to their craft draft list and wing selection. Other than that, I would have given 5 stars.

LruQDsP-SLNDkECceDtvAA.text: If you're just looking for some quick, simple American food, this is a safe bet. We started with the loaded potato skins appetizer which comes in 4. The potato itself was nice and crispy but too much dried cheese caked on top for my liking.   I opted for the black bean burger with a side of sweet potato fries for my entree. The sweet potato fries come with a cinnamon dip on the side which was delicious. The patty was one of the better veggie burgers I've had in comparison to other bar restaurants I've been to so I recommend it for my vegetarians out there. However, the salsa on top was a weird choice, and it didn't go well with the burger in my opinion. My boyfriend ordered the nachos as his meal which he would not recommend. The portion size was generous but the quality was mediocre.   The restaurant itself is smaller and got pretty loud for a random weekday evening. Make sure to bring your butt cushions because those wooden seats can get a tad uncomfortable if you sit there long enough.

XhlFFljCl6u7-Fyg4y7sFA.text: I wanted to give Lot 17 more stars but too many things service wise didn't go as we would have liked. The server was swamped and our orders weren't taken until well after we were ready. Groups who arrived after us had their orders taken before us. Another group was ordering beers (after we were told by our server she'd be right back to take our order) and she took their second beer order and retrieved the beers before even looking our way again. Should have only been here an hour, but were here for over an hour and a half.   I had the coconut chicken salad which was AWESOME. The chicken was so crispy with a subtle sweetness. Overpriced at $13 though. Come on, with a tip I spent $16 total..for a salad at a bar restaurant!   My friend had the blue cheese burger which she said was just OK. She ordered it medium and it came out well done which was disappointing. Props on the sweet potato fries though - they were excellent.

CAX5SMSO02KlID7F3xmZ7A.text: Here's the deal. Our waitress was doing the best she possibly could given the fact that it appeared she was the only one working on a busy Sunday afternoon.   It looked like the chef actually had to come out and bus the tables which sat for quite a while.  The food was good. Pittsburgh salad with steak was a nice sized portion.  The turkey club was very good.  The burger came out medium well to well and was ordered medium.  The Reuben was eh.  I liked it and it deserves another visit for sure, but management has to do a better job staffing.  The server was spread way too thin and because of that, refills were a bit lacking.  Food came out quickly tho and she was very polite

WXhmooVJf5QfLMcKAYBVbA.text: great selection of beers on tap, food is far above average, i usually get the rueben but everything i've tried has been delicious  atmosphere is nice, none of that cliquey-whoareyou-weirdstare-crap, bar features an open air window and sidewalk tables outside, place is clean, service is fast and friendly, portions are good, prices are fair the space has that long, narrow shotgun style, so the bar can get pretty tight fairly quickly, but the dining area is roomy enough  cool lil joint with good beer and good food, always worth a revisit

8RAIzOmPFE7KERd5JLst_Q.text: I really enjoyed my time here over thanksgiving break. It's a really great space with an all-ages crowd that is really fun! I went for a friendsgiving with my good friend and her family and friends, the drinks were great pours, the appetizers were delicious. The chicken strips were breaded perfectly and were succulent, the sauces that came on the side were really good! Great potato skins, and a great selection of drinks (wine, beer, etc.)   Overall, I would definitely recommend visiting this place! The atmosphere is very fun for all ages!

NEkoWg7U7H0447GZeSz1dg.text: First time I have ever been to this place. We were looking for something good to eat but nothing too over the top. We walked in and the atmosphere was nice. The menu had a great selection of American style food. I had the mixed side salad which had Mixed greens, red onions, bleu cheese, strawberries and blueberries and pecan. Then I had the Smoke House Chicken sandwich which was grilled chicken with bbq sauce bacon and cheddar cheese, lettuce, tomato and onion and a side of cajun fries. The food was excellent and the waitress was very friendly and attentive as well. Will definitely make this a place I frequent.

GRHtGIeS3AKf0lfXTZT9fw.text: Really delightful brunch.  I loved that it was a normal sized menu (front of one 8x10 page), but they had fun twists on all of the basics - frittata, eggs & bacon, French toast.  I want to come back to try it again because what I had was really delicious.

ukmys3JCL4Fjk_U19CiXyA.text: I love this place. Great food, great service, and all-around wonderful experience every time I go. I haven't had one bad meal here. I highly recommend the portobello mushroom appetizer, the French onion soup, and fish tacos. You can't go wrong with Lot 17.

HRG__JM-QatVmSlLrMFczQ.text: Lot 17 is a great place, very clean with great service. The drinks are made well and the atmosphere is great. I got the jerk chicken with sweet potato fries and green beans. Probably my favorite thing on the menu. It comes with 2 slices of pineapple on top of a perfectly cooked chicken breast rubbed in a amazing jerk seasoning. The sweet potato fries come with a sweet dipping sauce that is crazy good

0H4Bsi3CtlkbCT3qLI2X6g.text: This place is pretty good. I stopped in with a friend for lunch- it was definitely a cozy place to be on a snowy afternoon! I ordered the fajita wrap which was solid; my hot toddy was unfortunately undrinkable due to the alcohol content. It's not far from where I live so I will be back to check this place out again.

yWrqjn2RRVnn34vyTjFgWg.text: Overall a really great experience, and I was with my best friend Michael so of course it's always a good time. They played really great music and had a super chill atmosphere. Very welcoming to all groups of people! Food was decent, we had the Rueben and portobello black bean melt. Service was slow since they only had one bartender and one server. Had to wait a while for our server to fill up our waters and check in on us but she was really sweet and friendly.

f-mtLOqUJJFkiyYrnXxXFw.text: This place was a lot more of a sports bar than I realized.  I had a friend say it was sorta hipster, with a steam punky style, but I found that to NOT be the case at all.  Small place, fast service.  TVs streaming annoying ads everywhere, the place is VERY LOUD, even on a slower night.  The staff was helpful, and the food was good.  We'd gotten the buffalo chicken sandwich (which my partner said needed MORE buffalo sauce) and the Rachel, which I felt was a little too salty.  The fries were good though, including every sauce they brought out.  DAT SUGAR BUTTER SAUCE for the sweet potato fires THOUGH.

aWj3xeZEZJ7gXcH672NDOw.text: Came here for NYE with a few friends. It was super crowded but overall fun atmosphere. Met the GM who was fun and accommodating and we were able To have a champagne toast at midnight! I'm not Local but it was a fun trip down to the burgh!

aW5h7E74z7kiaaSi0HAt6g.text: This is a typical sports bar located in Bloomfield. The menu is traditional American bar food that you would expect-- burgers, sandwiches, wings, etc.   If you are not looking for a loud, boisterous environment, I would avoid going here during a game. The last time I went for dinner, we spent the entire hour annoyed at some loudmouth yinzer watching the game, who thought he was entertaining the world with his commentary.   During non-sports experiences, the staff as well as the owner are all extremely friendly. If you are looking for a casual dinner in Bloomfield, you'll be satisfied here.

aLGaCSV0RKwo6PCxPsJeTA.text: This was a great find! We both ordered burgers and fires, and both were delicious! The burgers were cooked accordingly, the fries were great, and the sauces were amazing! I loved their sweet potato fries. They have an appropriate sized menu with various American dishes. We were only able to try two of the specialty burgers, so we're gonna go back and try the rest after this great experience! The staff was great, the environment was clean, and the atmosphere fit the restraunt. I would highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Lot 17 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. We loved the burgers!
Photo of Lot 17 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ITwMowJbE_UVZBjOPYm3vQ.text: Been going here for YEARS and just love it. Love it! Time to update! It's always an option on a Saturday afternoon when we're thinking of someplace to go to have an early dinner, late lunch or just grab a sammie and some beer. And it's a 30 minute drive for me! The service has always been good and we've never had an issue. We love the sandwiches and the wraps - my fave is the jalapeno steak wrap, although lately it seems that they've had too much wrap and not enough steak. But it IS real steak, not Steak-ums. That isn't always the case at other places.  But you can't go wrong - the Lot 17 salad is killer good. And the Jerk Chicken sandwich with the grilled pineapple is my wife's favorite. Not to mention the amazing sweet potato fries and the crack-like brown sugar butter dipping sauce. Always a good rotating selection of good beers and I'm always happy to choose among several I would drink anytime. In fact, I'm getting a strange craving for that steak wrap and some crack butter....

XT6_B1PPrVWC-oMDvaZjtg.text: I have been coming here for 11 years. Some things never change and i applaud the consistency. The lot 17 salad and the jerk chicken wings are the best things you will ever eat. I came here as a college student and have come to this place everytime im in town for the salad and the wings. They have been consistently delicious for the past 11 years so this review is way overdue!!!  Its a college bar with outstanding food! Order the jerk wings and the lot 17 salad and be prepared to be blown away!

photos.caption: Photo of Lot 17 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Lot 17 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

nwlmaB3_TRN9oE4V0mTjbw.text: Lot 17 on Liberty Avenue in Bloomfield serves up bar food nirvana!!! It's a pretty small space with plenty of wood surrounding the bar up front and a small booth filled dining room in the back. We've eaten here well over a dozen times and have always enjoyed our experiences here.  The sandwiches are killer!!!! I enjoy a good chicken sandwich and their Jerk Chicken Sandwich with grilled pineapple, provolone and roasted red peppers may just be my favorite chicken sandwich ever! I've also had the crab cake sandwich which is pretty darned fantastic, too. The jalapeno steak wrap is so delicious and spicy that it also ranks near the top of delightful choices. It's real steak cooked to order inside, too. The fish tacos are also a tasty option.  I'm not much of a French fry eater unless I'm at Lot 17. Their sweet potato fries are served with a side of brown sugar honey butter dipping sauce that I wish I could make at home. Tried and failed many times. It's the perfect compliment and I now refuse to get sweet potato fries anywhere else because I'd just flat out miss that sauce too much! Occasionally it shows up runny or less than perfect & I get sad but its still better than my best attempt to copy it.  Beer selection is good but could be more extensive. We've sampled some of the items off the appetizer menu in our early days coming here and realized they were totally unnecessary based on the amount of food you receive off the sandwich menu. We did manage to score some free chicken wings by texting Lot 17 using a sign on our booth once. Fun!  Overall, love this bar. We've continually had good service, the food comes out quickly & the prices are reasonable.

dFLomy8PRPfeP-wJ5xbR5w.text: I came here for lunch with a group of friends, one of whom knows either an owner or manager.  It was a busy football Sunday, but he managed to get us squeezed in and served in the limited amount of time that we had before we needed to be back at a dance class.  I opted for coconut chicken tenders, and let me tell you, they were HUGE, juicy, and crispy! Everything you want in a chicken tender!  The bar was full of folks watching multiple football games on different screens, and I got a good feeling about this being a neighborhood bar that is choc full of locals.  I enjoyed the experience and would go back iffen I found myself in Bloomfield and hankering for beers and bar food.

Ob3MVG14aGhOlO0XQGMz3w.text: I went here for my sister's birthday dinner. The atmosphere is great and super chill - I vibe with it! I had a vodka soda with lime to compliment the fish taco meal I got. The vodka soda was good (its hard to mess up). The fish tacos were amazing! I was such a big fan of the taste and it came with a really good spicy sauce that complimented it perfectly. I wasn't a big fan of the tortilla chips, but that's based on personal preference. I'd definitely come here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Lot 17 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lot 17 Tacos

jRbtXm8YrIIZdvMrvGLGCQ.text: Pros: huge open air windows & outdoor seating. Big bar.  Cons: worst black bean burger of my life. Not made in house. Burned black & hard & charred. Server kept ignoring us. Then when we finally tracked the check down she said she was buying my drink, but the bill reflected the same number of drinks we had.  Eh: large American flag hanging

A7OesuMPZh6WlCgoV9Xqsg.text: Stopped in for a drink and dessert. The space was very trendy and the bar area seemed like the place to be. Our homemade snickers pie dessert was great,(they only offered two desserts on the menu)   Service was non existent because the kitchen was closing soon, and the bar was jam packed for a Thursday night.

_gp2TGMqmDaY28r8IHNk0A.text: Lot 17 was exactly what I expected from the photos. It is a trendy hipster interior that was actually quite smaller than expected. There was a large bar in the front half with six or so bigger group tables in the back. There are also some places to stand and set your drink on a ledge. It was about half full on a Friday night at 11.   My boyfriend remarked as we bar crawled down Liberty Ave that "its funny how the prices increase as we move toward Lawrenceville". Prices were pretty much what I expected, a little over six dollars for each of our beers. After the tip I felt like my wallet was empty. Not necessarily worth the price if you just want to grab a beer. I did not get to try the food, though.

LEcB2Gok44E4HwVAcS3RTQ.text: Honestly no clue how I have never reviewed Lot before. My brothers basically live here and I've been plenty of times. The food is always solid and the bartenders are friendly. It's a solid choice for a sit down place in Bloomfield and always a good spot for sporting events.  One tip: wing night is Thursday but honestly I think these wings are some of the only ones worth full price. They're big and always on point.

photos.caption: Photo of Lot 17 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Caesar salad with steak
Photo of Lot 17 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Calamari and wings (wings are a really good size)

hCJZbaxuytrgao5fPavUWA.text: Reviewers raved about their food, so my girlfriend and I ate dinner here before attending a blues dance upstairs. She enjoyed a beer, and we both found the tacos an excellent deal for $2. They had big chunks of meat and were flavorful. In addition, the bartender was the right amount of attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Lot 17 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. $2 taco tacos!

PtYt2LyiF9lk2Y4S4ycJJg.text: I love going here for Taco Tuesdays! You really can't beat delicious tacos for $2 each (rotating flavor each week, can call ahead the day of to find out the special of the day) - with a side of perfectly fried fries.  My friends and I usually sit at the bar although there is great table seating as well. The decor/vibe is classy and comfortable and they have great drink options with special deals during happy hour.  Great, friendly service and welcoming atmosphere. Someday I look forward to trying the other things on their menu but for now I love going here for the tacos. They do also have a day for wings...

photos.caption: Photo of Lot 17 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tacos

W_wnLhOqlPlNXgpkAGXcjA.text: It's a comfy, clean, yet unpretentious bar! I've been to the lot a few times now and have never left disappointed.   Food-wise Lot 17 covers all the basic bar dishes, but does them all with a cool twist. I am a fan of their house salad, dry-rubbed wings, tacos, and French onion soup! I could order them all in one outing even though they don't typically go together! Tacos are $2 on Tuesday and wings are $6 for 10 on Thursdays. That's two good reasons to come here every week.  Lastly, I appreciate that they don't limit themselves to serving drafts from PA (there's a lot more out there beyond Yuengling). For example, they are currently pouring the Sculpin IPA, much to the delight of my fiancee and some cool Magic Hat brews.

4u45-N85gzfym_Ug6spSdA.text: The food here is bland bar food. The service sucks. I think we spoke to our server a total of 10 seconds. They had about two servers for the whole place so we can't really blame them- it was just understaffed. I ordered the chicken wrap with Cajun fries. It was a wrap full of dry unflavored chicken mixed with some dry feta. Needless to say, I needed water to even swallow it. I barely touched my food and the server didn't really care or think to ask if anything was wrong. Finally, the atmosphere is a typical bar. Wouldn't recommend. There are much better options in a foodie city like Pittsburgh.

oW6xjrvSZNKBFwexV2Wr8g.text: Visited Lot 17 last night for the first time. Overall our experience was great. The place has a good vibe and our server was friendly and attentive.   We started off with wings which were pretty good and very big. For our main meals we got a burger and a chicken sandwich. Both came on a big bun and with generous toppings. We were happy with both of our selections. They both came w a side, and we got fries. The fries reminded me of McDonalds fries - which can be good or bad depending on what you're in the mood for. They have a great list of beers on tap.   I think it's a great place for some tasty bar food and would return!

et2dwKbYpjpEmVpoSGma2g.text: When moving to a new city, I always look for that one place that is just "solid." Solid drinks, if you just want to meet with friends and watch a game or good food if you really do not feel like grocery shopping that night but you do not want to break the bank. That place for me is Lot17. Conveniently, located in Bloomfield if I choose to the Bigelow Bridge home. I usually can always find parking and somewhere to sit. The ceiling and design of the place have a historic local but relaxed and chill new place.  Dave (owner) and Patty (bartender) that is works usually during the week have always made every visit there great. Wings on Wednesday night is always a good call. Their food isn't anything that I would say, 'Yes, it's incredible you can not get it anywhere else" but rather for your money everything i've ordered hit the spot and was good. They also have weekly food specials that you will want to ask about when ordering if you did not see the little chalkboard.  You also can not beat their beer special on tap. Whatever brewery they are featuring you can get a 23 oz  for the same price as a pint.  You can not go wrong if you looking for a place to just kick back before going home for the evening or post up and watch any game you would like on one of the screens.

iYV2d4mUNUMASBQvqMQGzw.text: Great bar atmosphere for anyone interested in hearing the person/group they're with while being in a busy, happening environment. My group was greeted on a Saturday night by the owner (Dave) and directed to an open table. I was really impressed with Dave's approach to management/ownership and as the night went on it was clear his example kept things moving. I will definitely drink more beer here.

Czd9CexXztVtFnFH-uIsWA.text: Really liked the food and will return!   My boyfriend and I came here on a Friday night and the bar was busy but there were a few dining tables left. There wasn't a hostess nearby so we assumed that we sat ourself. It took a little to be greeted by the server but she had an obscene amount of tables to attend to- I'm assuming someone called off.   I ordered the Orange Crush cocktail and it was really tasty and really strong. Also ordered the chicken nachos as an appetizer. They were definitely good but I think the salsa was jarred and not homemade - or it tasted like it.   I ordered the buffalo chicken wrap with cajun fries and it didn't disappoint. I'm a little buffalo chicken obsessed and it had everything I was looking for. The chicken was tender and very lean, the buffalo sauce had to be homemade and tasted like it, and the ranch was my favorite. The Cajun fries were bomb and definitely have a nice kick to them.   My boyfriend got the steak fajita wrap and really enjoyed it!   We'll be back.
